net.sf.michaelo.activedirectory.ldapping

Class ActiveDirectoryLdapPinger

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.michaelo.activedirectory.ldapping.ActiveDirectoryLdapPinger

  • public class ActiveDirectoryLdapPinger
extends Object
    A Java implementation of the LDAP Ping process to a domain controller. An LDAP ping probes the liveliness and capabilities of a domain controller.

    Note: This class uses JUL to print log messages, enable at least level FINE to see output.

      • ping

        public NetlogonSamLogonBaseResponse ping(LdapPingRequest request)
                                  throws CommunicationException,
                                         NoSuchAttributeException
        Sends an LDAP ping request and returns a parsed response. The response needs to be cast to an actual implementation based on the NetlogonNtVersion requested. The version maps as follows:
        • NetlogonNtVersion.V5EX to NetlogonSamLogonExResponse
        • NetlogonNtVersion.V5 to NetlogonSamLogonResponse
        • NetlogonNtVersion.V1 to NetlogonSamLogonNt40Response
        Parameters:
        request - the LDAP ping request
        Returns:
        Netlogon SAM Logon response, never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if LdapPingRequest.getProtocol() is not null and neither tcp nor udp
        CommunicationException - if any resolution, communication, decoding related problem occurs
        NoSuchAttributeException - if the LDAP ping response does not contain the Netlogon attribute
